creditline: Gift of Leo and Doris Hodroff
description: white glazed group; Tyrolean dancers after J. J. Kaendler; legs intertwined
portfolio: From Salvaged from the wreck of the <I>Geldermalsen<I> (sank 1752)
text: Found in the shipwreck of the Dutch cargo ship, Geldermalsen, which sank in 1752, the pair of Chinese porcelain headless dancers imitate the Meissen model shown here. This pair were originally painted in the same bright color as the European model, but lost their enamel after nearly 250 years on the ocean floor.
title: Meissen-style Tyrolean dancers
